description: bit and cheek plaques; rigid mouthpiece of round section, flattened at each end and rolled into spiral rings to which reins were attached; cheek plaques in form of standing ibexes whose bodies are in profile relief with heads affronted and modeled in the round; on back of plaques are two protruding pins and two loops for fastening split strap of bridle; horn of one ibex broken off and missing; bronze
title: Bit and Cheek Plaques
